page.title: 03LANGUAGE
page.content: "Es lookin' brave an'tender es goin'to be slaggy for sure." . You got a git skate in your coat and your trousers are 'alf mast and graffted " These are two snippets of a type of conversation that is dying out in Newlyn. The first sentence is a reference to soft weather with a promise of misty rain,the second tells us that someone has piece torn out of his coat and his dirty trousers are high above his ankles. Many words and expressions used regulary and commonly about 50 years ago are now vanishing and only the very old can remember."Head boat 'referred to a runner in a race or any body leading in a game or competion.All hands was everyday speech for every body.
